channel.title: Graphics tablets
channel.description:
So like, me wanting to get into ZBrush and stuff, and to be more precise with photoshop, I decided to get a gfx tablet. I was looking for something cheap, but functional and I found this.
http://www.bestbuy.com/site/olspage.jsp?skuId=8601845&type=product&id=1192232279888
I've seen nothing but good reviews for it so far, so, what do you guys think? Is it really worth the price? Anybody had any experience with it?
kthxbai!! io9``

item.title: Graphics tablets
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

That’s the exact one I’m getting soon. Really nice.

item.title: Graphics tablets
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

My girlfriend has one of these. She uses them from drawing into Photoshop. I’m not 100% sure on the brand though, I’ll have to look into it. Hers is more of a monitor that you use the pen on, though. I’m guessing this is just a downgraded version?

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics tablets
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

im looking for one of these too, but dont really know what to go for…

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics tablets
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

I haven’t tried out that one, but my friend used to have one like that at school. The price is not that bad. 69$

He paid about, converting from NOK to USD about 120$ for his. Haven’t seen him use it lately though. I think the writing is gonna be a learning experience. Many people don’t expect getting handwritten e-mails ^^

I can’t help you out with reviews or anything, but it the pen is like a cool digital experience. You get the old fashioned “write and draw” feeling, just that this is digital

If your good with writing and drawing by hand, I would suggest this type of device.

Read full topic
